response.answer_text: Following are the best affordable resume writing services: Best Value: TopResume TopResume has a network of over 1,000 writers, including professionals from over 65 industries. You can get a free review of your existing resume to decide whether it’s usable or see what changes need to be made. If you choose to hire TopResume, the service starts with your old resume. No worries if you don’t have one yet. The company provides you with a questionnaire where you can provide the information needed to start your resume. Most Versatile: Let’s Eat Grandma Let’s Eat Grandma is a great place to start if you already have a resume, particularly if your current resume is already in good shape. The online resume service will review your existing resume and generate a Career Score for you. The starter package includes both a resume and a cover letter. The Accelerated Package includes a resume, cover letter, and LinkedIn profile. Best for Options: Write Step Resumes Ashley Watkins is a Job Search Coach and Nationally Certified Resume Writer with Write Step Resumes, LLC. Resume packages are based on the number of years you’ve been in your career. For example, if you’re just starting out, you’d choose one of the Career Newbie packages. On the other end of the spectrum, senior leaders who are looking for higher-paying roles can choose a Lite, Deluxe, or Supreme package. Best for Rate Shopping: LinkedIn ProFinder LinkedIn ProFinder is a service LinkedIn offers to help people find someone to help with various career services like professional headshot photography, interview prep, and resume writing. You start your search for a resume writer by answering some questions about what you’re looking for. Next, the ProFinder service matches you with some local professionals who can help with what you need. You can select whether you want to meet with someone in person or if you’re comfortable working virtually. This is a great option if you want to meet face to face to work on your resume. Write your own resume! It is not that hard, but it does take some time. Each resume must be adjusted to the specific job you are applying for and there fore you should not have someone else write a standard resume for you. Make sure that the education, past positions, projects and other stuff you include in the resume are all relevant to the specific job. Be precise - mention results and quantify when possible. Don’t write a novell - be short and to the point. Happy writing :-)
